1. General

1.1. Very Short Introductions

  • M. Goldsmith, Sound: A Very Short Introduction. Oxford University Press, 2015.

1.2. Internet Resources

  • “Oxford Music,” Oxford Music Online. https://www.oxfordmusiconline.com/ (accessed May 23, 2021).

2. Philosophy

2.1. General

2.2. Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy

  • A. Kania, “The Philosophy of Music,” in The Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy, Spring 2024., E. N. Zalta and U. Nodelman, Eds., Metaphysics Research Lab, Stanford University, 2024. Accessed: Jan. 07, 2025. [Online]. Available: https://plato.stanford.edu/archives/spr2024/entries/music/

2.3. Aesthetics

  • S. Downes, Ed., Aesthetics of Music: Musicological Perspectives, 1st edition. New York London: Routledge, 2016.

3.3. Biological Sciences, Misc

3.3.1. Ecology

  1. Texts
    • T. DeNora, Music-in-Action: Selected Essays in Sonic Ecology, 1st edition. Farnham: Ashgate Publishing Limited, 2011.
    • J. Southcott and L. de Bruin, Eds., Musical Ecologies: Instrumental Music Ensembles Around the World, 1st edition. Abingdon (Ox.) New York: Taylor & Francis Ltd, 2022.
    • A. S. Allen and K. Dawe, Current Directions in Ecomusicology: Music, Culture, Nature. Routledge, 2015.
    • K. Devine, Decomposed: The Political Ecology of Music. Cambridge, MA, USA: MIT Press, 2019.
    • T. DeNora, Music-in-Action: Selected Essays in Sonic Ecology, 1st edition. Farnham: Ashgate Publishing Limited, 2011.
    • J. Southcott and L. de Bruin, Eds., Musical Ecologies: Instrumental Music Ensembles Around the World, 1st edition. Abingdon (Ox.) New York: Taylor & Francis Ltd, 2022.
  2. Misc
    • “Vinyl records’ revival threatens environment and health | Environmental Working Group.” https://www.ewg.org/news-insights/news/2021/12/vinyl-records-revival-threatens-environment-and-health (accessed Jan. 05, 2022).
    • “We find several connections of sound to the environment: Radha Kapuria.” Accessed: Feb. 11, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://www.downtoearth.org.in/interviews/environment/we-find-several-connections-of-sound-to-the-environment-radha-kapuria-94379

3.3.2. NeuroScience

  • “Research Group Computational Auditory Perception – Max-Planck-Institut für empirische Ästhetik.” https://www.aesthetics.mpg.de/en/research/research-group-computational-auditory-perception.html (accessed Mar. 05, 2022).
  • D. Levitin, This is Your Brain on Music: Understanding a Human Obsession. Penguin UK, 2019.
  • O. Sacks, Musicophilia: Tales of Music and the Brain. Vintage Books, 2008.

3.3.3. Health

  1. Performance Medicine
    • J. Gagne, Belting: A Guide to Healthy, Powerful Singing. Berklee Press, 2015.
  2. Misc
    • S. Koelsch, Good Vibrations: Unlocking the Healing Power of Music. Cambridge University Press, 2025.
    • “Vibrations of Life: How Sound Affects Our Wellbeing,” The Wire. Accessed: Oct. 26, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://thewire.in/science/vibrations-of-life-how-sound-affects-our-wellbeing
    • “Five Ways Music Can Make You Healthier.” https://greatergood.berkeley.edu/article/item/five_ways_music_can_make_you_healthier (accessed Apr. 06, 2023).
    • “Music and health,” Harvard Health, Jun. 21, 2011. https://www.health.harvard.edu/newsletter_article/music-and-health (accessed Apr. 06, 2023).
    • “Why Music Works - The School Of Life.” https://www.theschooloflife.com/article/whats-the-point-of-music/ (accessed Apr. 06, 2023).
    • “The Importance of Music - The School Of Life.” https://www.theschooloflife.com/article/the-importance-of-music/ (accessed Apr. 06, 2023).
    • “How Music Can Heal Us - The School Of Life.” https://www.theschooloflife.com/article/how-music-can-heal-us/ (accessed Apr. 06, 2023).
    • “Music and Health: What You Need To Know,” NCCIH. https://www.nccih.nih.gov/health/music-and-health-what-you-need-to-know (accessed Apr. 17, 2023).
    • “American Music Therapy Association | American Music Therapy Association (AMTA).” https://www.musictherapy.org/ (accessed Apr. 17, 2023).
    • “Music and your health, with Daniel Levitin, PhD,” https://www.apa.org. https://www.apa.org/news/podcasts/speaking-of-psychology/music-health (accessed Apr. 17, 2023).
    • E. C. Lambiase Psyche Loui,Grace Leslie,Caroline Palmer,Jonathan Berger,Edward W. Large,Nicolò F. Bernardi,Suzanne Hanser,Julian F. Thayer,Michael A. Casey,Pier D., “How Music Can Literally Heal the Heart,” Scientific American. https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-music-can-literally-heal-the-heart/ (accessed Apr. 17, 2023).
    • G. Musgrave, C. Howard, A. Schofield, E. Silver, and M. S. Tibber, “Mental health and the music industry: an evolving intervention landscape,” The Lancet Psychiatry, vol. 10, no. 5, pp. 311–313, May 2023, doi: 10.1016/S2215-0366(23)00093-7.
    • “You Asked: Is Listening to Music Good For Your Health?,” Time, Apr. 26, 2018. https://time.com/5254381/listening-to-music-health-benefits/ (accessed Apr. 17, 2023).
    • “Music to your health,” Harvard Health, Feb. 01, 2021. https://www.health.harvard.edu/staying-healthy/music-to-your-health (accessed Apr. 17, 2023).
    • “Music and Health: What You Need To Know,” NCCIH. https://www.nccih.nih.gov/health/music-and-health-what-you-need-to-know (accessed Apr. 17, 2023).

            • General
            • Theory

          • Darbari
            • General

3.4. Basic Sciences, Misc

3.4.1. Physics

  1. Acoustics
    1. General
      • A. H. Benade, Fundamentals of Musical Acoustics: Second, Revised Edition, New edition. New York: Dover Publications Inc., 1990.
    2. Vocals
      • K. Bozeman, Practical Vocal Acoustics: Pedagogic Applications for Teachers and Singers: 1. Lanham: Rowman & Littlefield, 2022.
    3. Instrumental
      • A. Chaigne and J. Kergomard, Acoustics of Musical Instruments, 1st ed. 2016 edition. New York, New York: Springer-Verlag New York Inc., 2016.
    4. Misc
  2. Quantum Mechanics, Quantum Computing
    • E. R. Miranda, “The advent of quantum computer music: mapping the field,” Rep. Prog. Phys., vol. 87, no. 8, p. 086001, Jul. 2024, doi: 10.1088/1361-6633/ad627a.
    • “Uniting the mysterious worlds of quantum physics and music | Aeon Essays,” Aeon. https://aeon.co/essays/uniting-the-mysterious-worlds-of-quantum-physics-and-music (accessed Jul. 19, 2021).
    • N. Author, “Can we use quantum computers to make music?,” Physics World. Accessed: Jun. 01, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://physicsworld.com/a/can-we-use-quantum-computers-to-make-music/
  3. Misc

3.5. Mathematical, Computational Sciences, Misc

3.5.1. Mathematics

  • M. du Sautoy, “From Messiaen to Radiohead: How great music uses prime numbers,” Big Think. Accessed: May 28, 2025. [Online]. Available: https://bigthink.com/mini-philosophy/from-messiaen-to-radiohead-how-great-music-uses-prime-numbers/
  • E. Maor, Music by the Numbers: From Pythagoras to Schoenberg, Reprint edition. Princeton Univ Pr, 2020.
  • J. Fauvel, R. Flood, and R. Wilson, Music and Mathematics. Oxford: OUP Oxford, 2006.

    • P. Hudak and D. Quick, The Haskell School of Music: From Signals to Symphonies, 1st edition. Cambridge, United Kingdom ; New York, NY: Cambridge Univ Pr, 2018.

    • D. Cope, Virtual Music: Computer Synthesis of Musical Style. MIT Press, 2001.
      • Compositional styles (of at least, some western classical musicians) have been AIed (well enough to fool even some expert music professors) [/AI/, M. Mitchell]!

5. Core

5.1. Education

5.1.1. Formal Education

  1. Courses
    1. General
      • “Music and Theater Arts | MIT OpenCourseWare | Free Online Course Materials.” https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/music-and-theater-arts/ (accessed Sep. 05, 2021).
    2. CSE
      • “Music and Technology: Algorithmic and Generative Music,” MIT OpenCourseWare. https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/music-and-theater-arts/21m-380-music-and-technology-algorithmic-and-generative-music-spring-2010/ (accessed Sep. 05, 2021).
    3. Core
      • Fundamentals
        • “Fundamentals of Music,” MIT OpenCourseWare. https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/music-and-theater-arts/21m-051-fundamentals-of-music-spring-2007/ (accessed Sep. 05, 2021).
      • Musical Time
        • “Interdisciplinary Approaches to Musical Time,” MIT OpenCourseWare. https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/music-and-theater-arts/21m-542-interdisciplinary-approaches-to-musical-time-january-iap-2010/ (accessed Sep. 05, 2021).
      • Composition
        • “Introduction to Musical Composition,” MIT OpenCourseWare. https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/music-and-theater-arts/21m-065-introduction-to-musical-composition-spring-2014/ (accessed Sep. 05, 2021).
        • “Music Composition,” MIT OpenCourseWare. https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/music-and-theater-arts/21m-351-music-composition-fall-2008/ (accessed Sep. 05, 2021).
      • Improvisation
        • “Musical Improvisation,” MIT OpenCourseWare. https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/music-and-theater-arts/21m-355-musical-improvisation-spring-2013/ (accessed Sep. 05, 2021).
      • Miscellaneous
        • “Harmony and Counterpoint I,” MIT OpenCourseWare. https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/music-and-theater-arts/21m-301-harmony-and-counterpoint-i-spring-2005/ (accessed Sep. 05, 2021).
        • “Harmony and Counterpoint II,” MIT OpenCourseWare. https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/music-and-theater-arts/21m-302-harmony-and-counterpoint-ii-spring-2005/ (accessed Sep. 05, 2021).
        • “Developing Musical Structures,” MIT OpenCourseWare. https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/music-and-theater-arts/21m-113-developing-musical-structures-fall-2002/ (accessed Sep. 05, 2021).
        • “Musical Analysis,” MIT OpenCourseWare. https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/music-and-theater-arts/21m-350-musical-analysis-spring-2008/ (accessed Sep. 05, 2021).

                          • Misc
                            • D. Priest, Louis Laloy, 1st edition. Milton: Routledge, 2020.
                            • P. Griffiths, Igor Stravinsky: The Rake’s Progress. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1982.
                            • J. McGinness and P. C. van den Toorn, Stravinsky and the Russian Period: Sound and Legacy of a Musical Idiom, Reprint edition. Cambridge (GB): Cambridge University Press, 2015.
                            • J. N. Straus, Stravinsky’s Late Music. Cambridge: Cambridge Univ Pr, 2004.
                            • G. Griffiths, Ed., Stravinsky in Context. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2022.
                            • J. Cross, The Stravinsky Legacy: 8, Pbk Version ed. edition. Cambridge New York: Cambridge University Press, 2005.
                            • C. Joseph, Stravinsky Inside Out, Edition. New Haven, CT: Yale University Press, 2001.
                            • M. Oliver, Igor Stravinsky, Revised edition. London New York Lagny-sur-Marne: Phaidon Press, 2008.
                          • Handbooks, Companions, Readers
                            • J. Cross, Ed., The Cambridge Companion to Stravinsky, Revised ed. edition. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2003.
                          • Encyclopedias
                            • E. Campbell and P. O’Hagan, Eds., The Cambridge Stravinsky Encyclopedia. Cambridge: Cambridge Univ Pr, 2024.
                          • TROS
                            • P. Hill, Stravinsky: The Rite of Spring. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2000.
                          • Ballets
                            • C. M. Joseph, Stravinsky’s Ballets, Illustrated edition. New Haven: Yale University Press, 2011.
                          • Piano
                            • G. Griffiths, Stravinsky’s Piano: Genesis of a Musical Language, Illustrated edition. New York: Cambridge University Press, 2013.
                          • Education

                          • Communication, Misc
                            • P. Dahl, Modes of Communication in Stravinsky’s Works: Sign and Expression, 1st edition. London New York: Routledge, 2023.
                          • Writings
                            • I. Stravinsky, Poetics of Music in the Form of Six Lessons: 30, Revised edition. Cambridge, Mass: Harvard University Press, 1974.

                                  • Worldly Matters
                                    • History
                                      • A. Miner, Sitar and Sarod in the 18th and 19th Centuries. Motilal Banarsidass Publ., 2004.
                                        • A frequently cited resource for students of Indian music.
                                      • M. Katz, Lineage of Loss: Counternarratives of North Indian Music, Illustrated edition. Middletown, Connecticut: Wesleyan University Press, 2017.
                                      • A. McNeil, Inventing The Sarod: A Cultural History. Seagull Books, 2004.

                                    • Theory
                                      • G. Ruckert and A. A. Khan, The Classical Music of North India: The First Years Study. Munshiram Manoharlal Publishers, 1998.
                                        • A nice reference for novice sarod players.
                                      • A. Miner, Sitar and Sarod in the 18th and 19th Centuries. Motilal Banarsidass Publ., 2004.
                                        • A frequently cited resource for students of Indian music.

                            • ICM Recordings: Some Non Introductory Pieces
                              • Function/Mappings
                                • Rasa
                                  • General
                                    • “Rasa (aesthetics),” Wikipedia. Mar. 10, 2022. Accessed: Mar. 19, 2022. [Online]. Available: https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Rasa_(aesthetics)&oldid=1076290549
                                      • Śṛṅgāraḥ (शृङ्गारः): Romance, Love, Attractiveness. Presiding Deity: Vishnu. Colour: Light Green
                                      • Hāsyam (हास्यं): Laughter, Mirth, Comedy. Presiding Deity: Shiva. Colour: White
                                      • Raudram (रौद्रं): Fury. Presiding Deity: Shiva. Colour: Red
                                      • Kāruṇyam (कारुण्यं): Compassion, Mercy. Presiding Deity: Yama. Colour: Grey
                                      • Bībhatsam (बीभत्सं): Disgust, Aversion. Presiding Deity: Shiva. Colour: Blue
                                      • Bhayānakam (भयानकं): Horror, Terror. Presiding Deity: Yama. Colour: Black
                                      • Veeram (वीरं): Heroism. Presiding Deity: Indra. Colour: Saffron
                                      • Adbhutam (अद्भुतं): Wonder, Amazement. Presiding Deity: Brahma. Colour: Yellow
                                      • Śāntam: Peace Or Tranquility. Presiding Deity: Vishnu. Colour: Perpetual White.
                                  • Shringar
                                    • General
                                      • Śṛṅgāraḥ (शृङ्गारः): Romance, Love, attractiveness. Presiding deity: Vishnu. Colour: light green
                                    • Recordings

                        • Misc
                      • Theory
                        • General
                          • V. P. Singha And S. Benegal, An Introduction To Hindustani Classical Music: A Guidebook For Beginners. Roli Books, 2014.
                          • “Home,” Rajan Parrikar Music Archive. Accessed: Nov. 18, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://www.parrikar.org/
                            • Rajan Parrikar Music Archive
                              • A highly opinionated, 'inclusive' (as in, you'll often find likes of Lata Mangeshkar, Dagar bandhu on the very same page) web resource on Indian Classical Music. Novice students, and listeners past filmy, 'Music of the X' series sort of stages and transitioning into unadulterated raagdaari sangeet, will find it particularly useful.
                          • R. R. Menon: Excellent introductory (but not necessarily the best first) books on Indian Classical Music for everyone.
                            • R. R. Menon, Indian Classical Music: An Initiation. New Delhi: Vision Books, 1997.
                            • R. R. Menon, Indian Music: The Magic Of The Raga. Somaiya Publications, 1998.
                            • R. R. Menon, Penguin Dictionary of Indian Classical Music, First Edition. New Delhi, India ; New York, NY, USA: Penguin, 1995.
                        • Dictionaries
                          • P. Amarnath, The Dictionary of Hindustani Classical Music. Viking, 2020.
                        • Reference Works
                          • V. Bhatkhande, Hindustani Sangeet Paddhati Kramik Pustak Maalika. Sangeet Karyalay, 2017.
                        • Core
                          • Core Components
                            • Time
                              • Texts
                                • M. Clayton, Time in Indian Music: Rhythm, Metre, and Form in North Indian Rag Performance. Oxford University Press, 2008.
                                • G. M. Wegner, Vintage Tabla Repertory: Drum Composition of North Indian Classical Music, Har/Com edition. New Delhi: Munshiram Manoharlal Publishers, 2006.
                                • R. S. Gottlieb, Solo Tabla Drumming of North India: Its Repertoire, Styles and Performance Practices, Pap/Cas edition. Delhi: Motilal Banarsidass Publishers, 1998.
                              • Videos
                                • “Manjul BHARGAVA - Poetry, Drumming and Mathematics - YouTube.” Accessed: Dec. 17, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0LraLjkvgGo
                              • Misc
                            • Tonal X
                              • Compositional Forms
                                • V. Chandorkar, Compositional Forms of Hindustani Music: A Journey. Munshiram Manoharlal Publishers, 2012.
                              • Ragas
                                • N. A. Jairazbhoy, The Rāgs Of North Indian Music: Their Structure And Evolution. Popular Prakashan, 1995.
                                • J. Bor, The Raga Guide: A Survey of 74 Hindustani Ragas. Nimbus Records, 1992.
                                • P. Moutal, Hindustānī Rāga-s Index: Bibliographical References on Descriptions, Compositions, and Vistāra-s of Hindustānī Rāga-s Based on Selected Major Contemporary Works in Devanāgarī. Munshiram Manoharlal Publishers, 1991.
                            • Language
                              • S. Mudgal, A. Pradhan, and K. Ray, Shabd Aur Sangeet: Unravelling Song-text in India. Three Essays Collective, 2019.
                              • J. L. Martinez, Semiosis in Hindustani Music. Motilal Banarsidass Publ., 2001.
                              • F. Orsini and K. B. Schofield, Eds., Tellings and Texts: Music, Literature and Performance in North India. 2015.
                          • Medium X
                            • Vocal Music
                              • I. Srivastava, A Practical Guide To North Indian Classical Vocal Music: The Ten Basic Of Rā.Gs With Compositions And Improvisations., Munshiram Manoharlal Publishers, 2008.
                            • Instrumental Music
                              • G. Ruckert and A. A. Khan, The Classical Music of North India: The First Years Study. Munshiram Manoharlal Publishers, 1998.
                                • A nice reference for novice sarod players.

  • M. Nair, “In Meerut, one man is on a quest to recreate the magic of a legendary sarangi maker,” Scroll.in. https://scroll.in/magazine/1028123/in-meerut-one-man-is-on-a-quest-to-recreate-the-magic-of-a-legendary-sarangi-maker (accessed Jul. 16, 2022).
  • “Popular Music,” Cambridge Core. Accessed: Feb. 23, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://www.cambridge.org/core/publications/elements/popular-music
  • “Music,” Cambridge Core. Accessed: Feb. 23, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://www.cambridge.org/core/elements/subject/Music/A370B5604591CB3C7F9AFD892DDF7BD1
